title: How to Become a Cloud Engineer
headline: Learn about cloud engineering and how to become one without prior experience in this free online course.
description: Are you interested in building a career in cloud computing? Cloud engineering is one of the most in-demand tech jobs today. This course will teach you how to become a cloud engineer, what the job entails, the various types of cloud-related positions and the necessary skills, knowledge and certifications. Explore training options, salary and market considerations and interview preparation techniques for entry-level cloud computing jobs.
courseDescription:
Cloud computing is currently one of the fastest-growing professions. Tech giants like Amazon, Google, IBM, and Microsoft are hugely investing in their cloud infrastructure and are hiring cloud experts from all over the world. The most popular cloud computing role is cloud engineer. Other roles include cloud developers, solutions architects, cloud architects, and data engineers. They work closely with cloud engineers to ensure an organization's cloud-based systems are secure, reliable, and scalable. Are you looking to become a cloud engineer? As a cloud engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure of an organization's cloud computing platform. This includes configuring and managing cloud-based servers and deploying and maintaining applications in the cloud. In this course, we will show you how to start a career in cloud computing with the proper certification, training and coaching.

The first step to becoming a cloud engineer is to learn essential cloud computing skills. Joseph Holbrook, your instructor, will walk you through the list of skills a cloud engineer must have, including Linux, networking, security, containerization and virtualization. You will learn why you should master at least one of the three major cloud computing platforms and how to choose the best one, depending on your location and interest. Getting certified is one of the best ways of showing that you have knowledge of a specific cloud platform(s) and that you have the expertise. You will learn about the different certifications and how they can help you in the job market. We will provide information about various career paths in cloud computing that will allow you to gain knowledge and experience in the field. You will learn about the free and paid e-Learning courses you can take and the benefits of attending Meetups.

With over 320,000 active jobs for cloud engineers on LinkedIn worldwide, it can be overwhelming to determine which ones are entry-level and the best fit for you. We will guide you through the LinkedIn job search and teach you how to identify positions that align with your qualifications and experience. You'll discover how investing in boot camps and coaching can help you prepare for interviews and boost your confidence. The typical interview questions listed in this course will give you some insights on how to prepare for any cloud engineer interview. Did you know that cloud engineers make, on average, over $120,000 per year in the US? The career prospects in cloud computing are growing and creating more than a million jobs. If you still have doubts about why cloud engineering may be a great career, take this course, clear your doubts and get started.
